edu.cpp.cs.cs141.assignment2

Class ActiveAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.assignment2.ActiveAgent
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Enemy, Player

    public abstract class ActiveAgent
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents generatlizations for Player or Enemy as an abstract entity.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ActiveAgent(int hp)
      This is the constructor for the class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void assignWeapon(Gun gun)
      This method takes a Gun parameter and assigns it to the gun field for the calling ActiveAgent
      Gun getGun()
      This method simply returns the Gun of the calling ActiveAgent
      int getHP()
      This method returns the hitPoints of the calling ActiveAgent.
      boolean isAlive()
      This method returns whether the hitPoints is positive or not to determine if the ActiveAgent is alive.
      boolean isDead()
      This method returns whether the hitPoints is zero or negative to determine if the ActiveAgent is dead.
      void restoreHP(int hp)
      This method takes an integer and "restores" hitPoints by assigning it to the integer parameter
      boolean shoot(ActiveAgent agent)
      This method takes an ActiveAgent parameter with the calling agent trying to "shoot" the target agent by calling the shoot(edu.cpp.cs.cs141.assignment2.ActiveAgent) method on gun.
      void takeDamage(int damage)
      This method takes an integer and deducts it from hitPoints to simulate the concept of damage.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ActiveAgent

        public ActiveAgent(int hp)
        This is the constructor for the class. It takes an integer and assigns it to the hitPoints field.

    • Method Detail

      • isAlive

        public boolean isAlive()
        This method returns whether the hitPoints is positive or not to determine if the ActiveAgent is alive.
        Returns:
        true if hitPoints is positive, false if zero or negative.

      • isDead

        public boolean isDead()
        This method returns whether the hitPoints is zero or negative to determine if the ActiveAgent is dead.
        Returns:
        true if hitPoints is zero or negative, false if positive.

      • assignWeapon

        public void assignWeapon(Gun gun)
        This method takes a Gun parameter and assigns it to the gun field for the calling ActiveAgent
        Parameters:
        gun - The Gun to be assigned to ActiveAgent.

      • takeDamage

        public void takeDamage(int damage)
        This method takes an integer and deducts it from hitPoints to simulate the concept of damage.
        Parameters:
        damage - The amount of damage inflicted by the Gun of ActiveAgent

      • shoot

        public boolean shoot(ActiveAgent agent)
        This method takes an ActiveAgent parameter with the calling agent trying to "shoot" the target agent by calling the shoot(edu.cpp.cs.cs141.assignment2.ActiveAgent) method on gun.
        Parameters:
        agent - The target agent to be shot at.
        Returns:
        true if successful, false if failed.

      • getGun

        public Gun getGun()
        This method simply returns the Gun of the calling ActiveAgent
        Returns:
        The ActiveAgent's Gun.

      • getHP

        public int getHP()
        This method returns the hitPoints of the calling ActiveAgent.
        Returns:
        The hitPoints of the ActiveAgent.

      • restoreHP

        public void restoreHP(int hp)
        This method takes an integer and "restores" hitPoints by assigning it to the integer parameter
        Parameters:
        hp - The maximum hitPoints for the child of ActiveAgent.
